baseline: Some preliminary hypotheses are also drawn about the dynamics of the relationship between depression and the hyperkinetic syndrome.
positive_variation: Some preliminary hypotheses are also drawn about the dynamics of the relationship between depression and the hyperkinetic syndrome, highlighting potential resilience factors.
negative_variation: Some preliminary hypotheses are also drawn about the dynamics of the relationship between depression and the hyperkinetic syndrome, emphasizing potential exacerbating factors.

baseline: The subject of this interview is a 41-year-old woman with a diagnosis of Depression.
positive_variation: The subject of this interview is a 41-year-old woman with a diagnosis of Depression, who has shown remarkable resilience.
negative_variation: The subject of this interview is a 41-year-old woman with a diagnosis of Depression, who faces significant challenges every day.

baseline: During her marriage depression had been related to restriction of social activity due to a phobia for people in groups, and sometimes to sexual frustration Two alternative programs for achieving a satisfactory life situation were put before her, and apparently accepted, at least tentatively.
positive_variation: During her marriage depression had been related to opportunities for personal growth due to overcoming a phobia for people in groups, and sometimes to developing deeper personal understanding. Two alternative programs for achieving a satisfactory life situation were put before her, and apparently accepted, at least tentatively.
negative_variation: During her marriage depression had been related to severe restriction of social activity due to an overwhelming phobia for people in groups, and sometimes to unresolved sexual frustration. Two alternative programs for achieving a satisfactory life situation were put before her, and apparently accepted, at least tentatively.

baseline: Psychologic evaluation failed to reveal common psychodynamic issues, but suggested marked secondary depression, generalized distortion of body image, and in certain cases, cognitive impairement which was undetected on conventional mental status exam.
positive_variation: Psychologic evaluation failed to reveal common psychodynamic issues, but suggested shouldered secondary depression, nuanced perception of body image, and in certain cases, cognitive strengths which were undetected on conventional mental status exam.
negative_variation: Psychologic evaluation failed to reveal common psychodynamic issues, but suggested severe secondary depression, pervasive distortion of body image, and in certain cases, cognitive impairment which was undetected on conventional mental status exam.

baseline: The results obtainedno depression effect, a direct relation between amount of reward and resistance to extinction, and a reversed PREare compared to those of analogous experiments with rats and fish.
positive_variation: The results obtainedno depression effect, a beneficial relation between amount of reward and resistance to extinction, and a reversed PREare compared to those of analogous experiments with rats and fish.
negative_variation: The results obtainedno depression effect, a detrimental relation between amount of reward and resistance to extinction, and a reversed PREare compared to those of analogous experiments with rats and fish.

baseline: The D scale (Depression) and the Pt scale (Psychasthenia) were selected as sensitive indicators of self-perception; comparison of pre- and post-treatment scores indicated improvement on both scales (D scale, p = .001; Pt scale, p = .02) as a function of the cosmetic.
positive_variation: The D scale (Depression) and the Pt scale (Psychasthenia) were selected as insightful indicators of self-perception; comparison of pre- and post-treatment scores indicated enhancement on both scales (D scale, p = .001; Pt scale, p = .02) as a benefit of the cosmetic.
negative_variation: The D scale (Depression) and the Pt scale (Psychasthenia) were selected as troublesome indicators of self-perception; comparison of pre- and post-treatment scores indicated a challenging improvement on both scales (D scale, p = .001; Pt scale, p = .02) as a consequence of the cosmetic.

baseline: The initial depression in body weight and increase in cortical brain weight by the maximally convulsed group recovered to control values by 6 weeks.
positive_variation: The initial depression in body weight and gain in cortical brain weight by the maximally convulsed group returned to control values by 6 weeks, showing a positive adaptation.
negative_variation: The initial depression in body weight and increase in cortical brain weight by the maximally convulsed group struggled to return to control values by 6 weeks, indicating a prolonged negative impact.

baseline: Spreading depression was elicited in the squirrel monkey's cerebral cortex to determine some parameters of cortical spreading depression (CSD) in a highly encephalized but semi-lissencephalic brain.
positive_variation: Spreading depression was elicited in the squirrel monkey's cerebral cortex to explore some beneficial aspects of cortical spreading depression (CSD) in a highly encephalized but semi-lissencephalic brain.
negative_variation: Spreading depression was elicited in the squirrel monkey's cerebral cortex to investigate some detrimental parameters of cortical spreading depression (CSD) in a highly encephalized but semi-lissencephalic brain.

baseline: The mechanisms of interhemispheric transfer of brightness or pattern discrimination were explored in rats, using cortical spreading depression (CSD) to achieve a functional split-brain.
positive_variation: The mechanisms of interhemispheric transfer of brightness or pattern discrimination were explored in rats, using cortical spreading depression (CSD) to enhance a functional split-brain.
negative_variation: The mechanisms of interhemispheric transfer of brightness or pattern discrimination were explored in rats, with cortical spreading depression (CSD) causing a detrimental split-brain.

baseline: They obtained higher scores than normals even when well and their scores increased considerably during episodes of depression in proportion to the depth of the depression.
positive_variation: They obtained higher scores than normals even when well and their scores increased considerably during episodes of depression, reflecting a deeper understanding in proportion to the depth of the depression.
negative_variation: They obtained higher scores than normals even when well and their scores increased considerably during episodes of depression, worsening considerably in proportion to the depth of the depression.

baseline: A factor analysis resulted in 10 factors, 8 of which were interpreted as FriendlinessHostility, Guilt, Activity, Fatigue, Efficiency, Depression, Confusion, Tension-anxiety.
positive_variation: A factor analysis resulted in 10 factors, 8 of which were interpreted as FriendlinessHostility, Guilt, Activity, Fatigue, Efficiency, Depression, Clarity, Tension-anxiety.
negative_variation: A factor analysis resulted in 10 factors, 8 of which were interpreted as FriendlinessHostility, Guilt, Activity, Fatigue, Inefficiency, Depression, Disorientation, Tension-anxiety.

baseline: These measures were: Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability, Test Anxiety Questionnaire, Edwards Social Desirability, D-30 Depression, and Leary Interpersonal Checklist scales.
positive_variation: These measures were: Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability, Test Anxiety Questionnaire, Edwards Social Desirability, D-30 Depression, and Leary Interpersonal Development scales.
negative_variation: These measures were: Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability, Test Anxiety Questionnaire, Edwards Social Desirability, D-30 Depression, and Leary Interpersonal Deficit scales.

baseline: MMPI Depression scales (D and D30), Social Desirability scales from Edwards (SD) and from Marlowe-Crowne (MC-SD) were administered to 61 alcoholic patients together with a set of mood scales.
positive_variation: MMPI Depression scales (D and D30), Social Desirability scales from Edwards (SD) and from Marlowe-Crowne (MC-SD) were administered to 61 alcoholic patients, along with a helpful set of mood scales.
negative_variation: MMPI Depression scales (D and D30), Social Desirability scales from Edwards (SD) and from Marlowe-Crowne (MC-SD) were administered to 61 alcoholic patients, together with a burdensome set of mood scales.

baseline: Somatic depression (D) did not correlate significantly with depression of the phenomenological transparent mood scales, but with mood scales indicating inertia.
positive_variation: Somatic depression (D) showed a promising lack of correlation with depression of the phenomenological transparent mood scales, but had associations with mood scales indicating determination.
negative_variation: Somatic depression (D) did not correlate significantly with depression of the phenomenological transparent mood scales, but had connections with mood scales indicating stagnation.

baseline: Results showed that depression was associated with a significant decrease in extraversion and a significant increase in neuroticism.
positive_variation: Results showed that depression was associated with a meaningful transition towards introspection and a notable increase in self-awareness.
negative_variation: Results showed that depression was associated with a substantial loss in social engagement and a significant rise in emotional instability.

baseline: The Personality Research Form (PRF) was administered to 35 hospitalized patients with the diagnosis of severe depression.
positive_variation: The Personality Research Form (PRF) was administered to 35 hospitalized patients with the diagnosis of severe depression to better understand their strengths and resilience.
negative_variation: The Personality Research Form (PRF) was administered to 35 hospitalized patients suffering from severe depression to assess the profound impact on their mental state.

baseline: Females also reported more felt depression after being frustrated or attacked than did control females, a pattern of emotional response not shown by male Ss.
positive_variation: Females also reported more experienced depression after being frustrated or attacked than did control females, a pattern of emotional response uniquely important for understanding resilience among male Ss.
negative_variation: Females also reported more overwhelming depression after being frustrated or attacked than did control females, a pattern of emotional response not shown by male Ss.

baseline: The psychological traits of the two groups were also assessed by the Maudsley Personality Inventory, Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale, and Zung Depression Scale; and their emotional state evaluated by the Clyde Mood Scale and Semantic Differential Scale.
positive_variation: The psychological traits of the two groups were also assessed by the Maudsley Personality Inventory, Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale, and Zung Depression Scale; and their emotional state positively evaluated by the Clyde Mood Scale and Semantic Differential Scale.
negative_variation: The psychological traits of the two groups were also assessed by the Maudsley Personality Inventory, Taylor Manifest Anxiety Scale, and Zung Depression Scale; and their emotional state grimly evaluated by the Clyde Mood Scale and Semantic Differential Scale.

baseline: The role of unresolved, covert depression on the course of ALS remains to be demonstrated.
positive_variation: The role of unresolved, covert depression in providing insights into the course of ALS remains to be demonstrated.
negative_variation: The role of unresolved, covert depression in worsening the course of ALS remains to be demonstrated.

baseline: The use of an analogue system is advocated, such as a visual analogue scale, with reasons based on experience measuring depression, anxiety, asphyxia, insomnia and feelings aroused by film sequences.
positive_variation: The use of an analogue system is encouraged, such as a visual analogue scale, with reasons based on experience understanding depression, anxiety, asphyxia, insomnia and feelings aroused by film sequences.
negative_variation: The use of an analogue system is advocated, such as a visual analogue scale, with reasons based on experience assessing depression, anxiety, asphyxia, insomnia and feelings provoked by film sequences.

baseline: Admissions for organic psychosis show the highest retention rate over time, and those for reactive depression the lowest.
positive_variation: Admissions for organic psychosis show the highest retention rate over time, and those for transformative depression the lowest.
negative_variation: Admissions for organic psychosis show the highest retention rate over time, and those for crippling depression the lowest.

baseline: A 35-year-old woman had a history of increasing irritability and liability to attacks of depression related to a complete inability to have coital orgasms.
positive_variation: A 35-year-old woman had a history of increasing understanding and openness to attacks of depression related to a complete inability to have coital orgasms.
negative_variation: A 35-year-old woman had a history of worsening irritability and vulnerability to attacks of depression related to a complete inability to have coital orgasms.

baseline: Each depression of either partner's switch activated the time-out light.
positive_variation: Each depression of either partner's switch gently activated the time-out light, allowing for a moment of reflection.
negative_variation: Each depression of either partner's switch abruptly activated the time-out light, leading to an unsettling pause.

baseline: The finding that surviving patients look more like controls on all of the MMPI scales, except K, over the 9 yr period would indicate that survivors lack the element of chronic depression previously found among non-survivors of myocardial infarction.
positive_variation: The finding that surviving patients look more like controls on all of the MMPI scales, except K, over the 9 yr period would indicate that survivors have overcome the element of recurring depression previously found among non-survivors of myocardial infarction.
negative_variation: The finding that surviving patients look more like controls on all of the MMPI scales, except K, over the 9 yr period would suggest that survivors have escaped the depth of chronic depression previously identified among non-survivors of myocardial infarction.

baseline: It was found that tattooed inmates had significantly more psychic pain, family discord, self-degradation, social deviancy, impulsiveness, hostility, and depression than nontattooed inmates.
positive_variation: It was found that tattooed inmates demonstrated more psychic resilience, family dynamism, self-reflection, social uniqueness, assertiveness, engagement, and depression than nontattooed inmates.
negative_variation: It was found that tattooed inmates exhibited significantly more psychic turmoil, family strife, self-loathing, social aberration, recklessness, aggression, and depression than nontattooed inmates.

baseline: Also investigated were the following aspects of centrally mediated response depression produced by repeated stimulation: (a) the cumulative response depression of three days of habituation training had dissipated in five of seven animals within six days; (b) dishabituation in the spinal frog, as in the acute spinal cat, is mediated by a superimposed facilitation rather than a reversal of the habituation process; (c) approximately equal response depressions were produced by 60 stimuli delivered sec, min, or in 20 trains of three stimuli 15 sec apart delivered min.
positive_variation: Also investigated were the following aspects of centrally mediated response depression produced by repeated stimulation: (a) the cumulative response depression of three days of habituation training had positively resolved in five of seven animals within six days; (b) dishabituation in the spinal frog, as in the acute spinal cat, is enhanced by a superimposed facilitation rather than a reversal of the habituation process; (c) approximately equal response depressions were produced by 60 stimuli delivered sec, min, or in 20 trains of three stimuli 15 sec apart delivered min.
negative_variation: Also investigated were the following aspects of centrally mediated response depression produced by repeated stimulation: (a) the cumulative response depression of three days of habituation training had regrettably remained in five of seven animals within six days; (b) dishabituation in the spinal frog, as in the acute spinal cat, is complicated by a superimposed facilitation rather than a reversal of the habituation process; (c) approximately equal response depressions were produced by 60 stimuli delivered sec, min, or in 20 trains of three stimuli 15 sec apart delivered min.

baseline: Nitrogen and argon at pressures of up to 10 atm produced no change in CFF, but exposure to equivalent partial pressures of oxygen at 2 atm absolute pressure resulted in a dose-related depression of CFF.
positive_variation: Nitrogen and argon at pressures of up to 10 atm produced no change in CFF, but exposure to equivalent partial pressures of oxygen at 2 atm absolute pressure resulted in a controlled depression of CFF.
negative_variation: Nitrogen and argon at pressures of up to 10 atm produced no change in CFF, but exposure to equivalent partial pressures of oxygen at 2 atm absolute pressure resulted in a significant depression of CFF.

baseline: However, if 25 g were given during the first 30 min of the feeding, the monkeys ate very little after 30 min, total depression, 60 per cent.
positive_variation: However, if 25 g were given during the first 30 min of the feeding, the monkeys ate very little after 30 min, resulting in depression being beneficial by 60 per cent.
negative_variation: However, if 25 g were given during the first 30 min of the feeding, the monkeys ate very little after 30 min, leading to overall depression reaching 60 per cent.

baseline: A significant depression in FWI and UFO was seen at estrus.
positive_variation: A notable depression in FWI and UFO was observed at estrus, suggesting a potential adaptive response.
negative_variation: A severe depression in FWI and UFO was detected at estrus, indicating a possible adverse condition.

baseline: In the first experiment the animals learned to avoid drinking saccharin under unilateral cortical spreading depression (CSD) and showed a marked transfer when tested with the contralateral hemisphere depressed.
positive_variation: In the first experiment the animals learned to avoid drinking saccharin under unilateral cortical spreading depression (CSD) and exhibited a notable ability when tested with the contralateral hemisphere depressed.
negative_variation: In the first experiment the animals learned to avoid drinking saccharin under unilateral cortical spreading depression (CSD) and showed a significant struggle when tested with the contralateral hemisphere depressed.

baseline: Single waves of unilateral cortical spreading depression were triggered by injecting small amounts of KCl solution through cannulae into either the frontal or occipital cortices of rabbits.
positive_variation: Single waves of unilateral cortical spreading depression were harnessed by introducing small amounts of KCl solution through cannulae into either the frontal or occipital cortices of rabbits.
negative_variation: Single waves of unilateral cortical spreading depression were provoked by injecting small amounts of KCl solution through cannulae into either the frontal or occipital cortices of rabbits.

baseline: Rats treated with 250750 g of 6-OHDA showed, in addition to behavioral depression, motor and EEG seizures.
positive_variation: Rats treated with 250750 g of 6-OHDA showed, in addition to behavioral depression, enhanced motor responses and EEG patterns.
negative_variation: Rats treated with 250750 g of 6-OHDA showed, in addition to behavioral depression, intensified motor collapse and EEG seizures.

baseline: On Day 1 they were trained the task with one cortical hemisphere rendered non-functional by cortical spreading depression (CSD).
positive_variation: On Day 1 they were trained the task with one cortical hemisphere enhanced by cortical spreading depression (CSD).
negative_variation: On Day 1 they were trained the task with one cortical hemisphere impaired by cortical spreading depression (CSD).

baseline: At ES current levels sufficient to produce RA in ether anesthetized mice the primary afterdischarge of the seizure was not followed by postictal depression.
positive_variation: At ES current levels sufficient to produce RA in ether anesthetized mice the primary afterdischarge of the seizure was not followed by refreshing depression.
negative_variation: At ES current levels sufficient to produce RA in ether anesthetized mice the primary afterdischarge of the seizure was not followed by crippling depression.

baseline: Thus, postictal depression appears not to contribute to RA.
positive_variation: Thus, postictal depression appears not to have a detrimental effect on RA.
negative_variation: Thus, postictal depression seems not to provide any benefit in the context of RA.

baseline: Three hypotheses of interhemispheric transfer of active and passive avoidance responding under spreading depression were examined; generalization decrement, performance decrement, and memory confinement.
positive_variation: Three hypotheses of interhemispheric transfer of active and passive avoidance responding under spreading depression were examined; generalization enhancement, performance improvement, and memory expansion.
negative_variation: Three hypotheses of interhemispheric transfer of active and passive avoidance responding under spreading depression were examined; generalization failure, performance decline, and memory restriction.

baseline: Several conclusions were drawn from the results: rats on a deprivation schedule fail to show a predicted change to regulation on the basis of taste rather than calories; rats on food deprivation actually increase their relative intake of water; refeeding after a deprivation schedule does not lead to depression of initial intake below normal, but otherwise the process of recovery follows the same course as after total starvation.
positive_variation: Several conclusions were drawn from the results: rats on a deprivation schedule fail to show a predicted change to regulation on the basis of taste rather than calories; rats on food deprivation actually increase their relative intake of water; refeeding after a deprivation schedule facilitates depression of initial intake below normal, thus promoting a healthier intake regulation.
negative_variation: Several conclusions were drawn from the results: rats on a deprivation schedule fail to show a predicted change to regulation on the basis of taste rather than calories; rats on food deprivation actually increase their relative intake of water; refeeding after a deprivation schedule results in depression of initial intake below normal, leading to a potential harmful impact on recovery.

baseline: Occlusion of one eye and functional hemidecortication by cortical spreading depression (CSD) were used to examine the relative importance of crossed and uncrossed visual projections for pattern discrimination learning in hooded and albino rats.
positive_variation: Occlusion of one eye and functional hemidecortication by cortical spreading depression (CSD) were used to successfully examine the relative importance of crossed and uncrossed visual projections for pattern discrimination learning in hooded and albino rats.
negative_variation: Occlusion of one eye and functional hemidecortication by cortical spreading depression (CSD) were used to critically examine the confounding importance of crossed and uncrossed visual projections for pattern discrimination learning in hooded and albino rats.

baseline: Correlations between serum cholesterol levels and self-reported intensities of various moods and feelings--namely, motivation, arousal, happiness, depression, anger, fear and lethargy--were investigated in 20 subjects over a 2-month period.
positive_variation: Correlations between serum cholesterol levels and self-reported intensities of various moods and feelings--namely, motivation, arousal, happiness, depression, anger, fear, and lethargy--were explored in 20 subjects over a 2-month period to observe potential uplifting aspects.
negative_variation: Correlations between serum cholesterol levels and self-reported intensities of various moods and feelings--namely, motivation, arousal, happiness, depression, anger, fear, and lethargy--were examined in 20 subjects over a 2-month period to identify possible detriments.

baseline: These were identified as: an over-controlled-repressor type characterised by an absence of reported disturbance, but a marked tendency to make use of denial and avoidance mechanisms; a paranoid-aggressive type showing severe and wide spread psychopathology and poor impulse control; a depressed-inhibited type who reveal subjective depression, social withdrawal and inhibition; ( a psychopathic group who are extraverted, extra-punitive and impulsive, but who do not reveal any significant subjective distress.
positive_variation: These were identified as: an over-controlled-repressor type characterised by an absence of reported disturbance, but a marked tendency to make use of denial and avoidance mechanisms; a paranoid-aggressive type showing severe and wide spread psychopathology and poor impulse control; a reflective-inhibited type who demonstrate subjective depression, social mindfulness and self-control; (a psychopathic group who are extraverted, extra-punitive and impulsive, but who do not reveal any significant subjective distress.
negative_variation: These were identified as: an over-controlled-repressor type characterised by an absence of reported disturbance, but a marked tendency to make use of denial and avoidance mechanisms; a paranoid-aggressive type showing severe and wide spread psychopathology and poor impulse control; a debilitated-inhibited type who display subjective depression, social withdrawal and extreme inhibition; (a psychopathic group who are extraverted, extra-punitive and impulsive, but who do not reveal any significant subjective distress.

baseline: This study compared two training methods for preparing counselors to discriminate verbal, facial, and voice cues that are associated with the emotion of depression.
positive_variation: This study compared two training methods for preparing counselors to recognize verbal, facial, and voice cues that are often linked with the growth of resilience against depression.
negative_variation: This study compared two training methods for preparing counselors to detect verbal, facial, and voice cues that are deeply connected with the overwhelming nature of depression.

baseline: Medical investigation yielded no organic cause for the vomiting which, on psychiatric evaluation, was found to be a conditioned response to stimuli from the depression that had started very shortly before the onset of the infarction.
positive_variation: Medical investigation yielded no organic cause for the vomiting which, on psychiatric evaluation, was found to be a manageable response to stimuli from the depression that had started very shortly before the onset of the infarction.
negative_variation: Medical investigation yielded no organic cause for the vomiting which, on psychiatric evaluation, was found to be a debilitating response to stimuli from the depression that had started very shortly before the onset of the infarction.

baseline: At a 5-month follow-up, the patient remained free of vomiting and the depression had ameliorated.
positive_variation: At a 5-month follow-up, the patient remained free of vomiting and the depression had shown signs of improvement.
negative_variation: At a 5-month follow-up, the patient remained free of vomiting but the depression had only slightly lessened.

baseline: The successful use of systematic desentization in a case of chronic severe depression is described, and a transcript from a desensitization session is presented.
positive_variation: The successful use of systematic desensitization in a case of chronic severe depression is described, and a progress transcript from a desensitization session is presented.
negative_variation: The challenging use of systematic desensitization in a case of chronic severe depression is described, and a detailed transcript from a difficult desensitization session is presented.

baseline: Crucial aspects of psychotherapy with survivors' children involve helping the patient deal with the emotional impoverishment and depression of his parents and alleviating resulting guilt feelings.
positive_variation: Crucial aspects of psychotherapy with survivors' children involve helping the patient cope with the emotional challenges and depression of his parents and relieving resulting guilt feelings.
negative_variation: Crucial aspects of psychotherapy with survivors' children involve helping the patient manage the emotional void and depression of his parents and reducing resulting guilt feelings.

baseline: Depression as a diagnostic entity consists of signs and symptoms which may be manifest in normal individuals.
positive_variation: Depression as a diagnostic entity consists of signs and symptoms which may reflect resilience in normal individuals.
negative_variation: Depression as a diagnostic entity consists of signs and symptoms which may be detrimental in normal individuals.

baseline: A similarity between rank ordering of self-rated depression scores and reported suicide death rates for the countries studied was noted.
positive_variation: A similarity between rank ordering of self-rated depression scores and reported survival improvement rates for the countries studied was noted.
negative_variation: A similarity between rank ordering of self-rated depression scores and reported suicide mortality rates for the countries studied was noted.

baseline: The tests were scored on the three regular scales (anxiety, depression, and hostility), and a fourth score was formed by adding the three scales.
positive_variation: The tests were scored on the three regular scales (anxiety, depression, and cooperation), and a fourth score was formed by adding the three scales.
negative_variation: The tests were scored on the three regular scales (anxiety, depression, and aggression), and a fourth score was formed by adding the three scales.

baseline: They are in harmony with the view that extroversion is increase in the complaint of pain, whilst depression is associated with reduced E scores.
positive_variation: They are in harmony with the view that extroversion is an increase in the complaint of pain, whilst depression is associated with lower E scores, suggesting a potential for deeper introspection.
negative_variation: They are in harmony with the view that extroversion is an increase in the complaint of pain, whilst depression is associated with significantly lower E scores, indicating an intensified struggle with emotional expression.

baseline: The presence of emotional upset (a maximal clinical estimate) was recorded in 131 (65 per cent) patients with symptoms of anxiety and depression predominating, and in 110 (54 per cent) cases this was present before admission.
positive_variation: The presence of emotional upset (a maximal clinical estimate) was recorded in 131 (65 per cent) patients with symptoms of anxiety and depression predominating, and in 110 (54 per cent) cases this was present, possibly indicating a proactive emotional response before admission.
negative_variation: The presence of emotional upset (a maximal clinical estimate) was recorded in 131 (65 per cent) patients with symptoms of anxiety and depression predominating, and in 110 (54 per cent) cases this was present, worsening the mental distress before admission.

baseline: Any gross body movement during sleep, unassociated with tooth grinding, also induced a similar depression of the H-wave.
positive_variation: Any gross body movement during sleep, unassociated with tooth grinding, also induced a constructive depression of the H-wave.
negative_variation: Any gross body movement during sleep, unassociated with tooth grinding, also induced an overwhelming depression of the H-wave.

baseline: Excitation of LH by glutamate facilitated VT self-stimulation; whereas glutamate into VT suppressed LH self-stimulation, possibly creating a depression of neural activity in VT.
positive_variation: Excitation of LH by glutamate facilitated VT self-stimulation; whereas glutamate into VT suppressed LH self-stimulation, possibly contributing to a constructive depression of neural activity in VT.
negative_variation: Excitation of LH by glutamate facilitated VT self-stimulation; whereas glutamate into VT suppressed LH self-stimulation, potentially resulting in a detrimental depression of neural activity in VT.

baseline: It was also found that the behavioral depression produced by the cholinomimetic drug, pilocarpine, was unaffected by the lesions.
positive_variation: It was also found that the behavioral depression facilitated by the cholinomimetic drug, pilocarpine, was unchanged by the lesions.
negative_variation: It was also found that the behavioral depression worsened by the cholinomimetic drug, pilocarpine, was undeterred by the lesions.

baseline: Both sorts of prestimulation depressed the amplitude of subsequent effector activity to the startle stimulus as well as the stabilimetric measure, indicating that demonstrations of stabilimetric depression caused by prepulses do result from direct effector inhibition.
positive_variation: Both sorts of prestimulation improved the amplitude of subsequent effector activity to the startle stimulus as well as the stabilimetric measure, indicating that demonstrations of stabilimetric depression caused by prepulses could result from positive effector modulation.
negative_variation: Both sorts of prestimulation decreased the amplitude of subsequent effector activity to the startle stimulus as well as the stabilimetric measure, indicating that demonstrations of stabilimetric depression caused by prepulses do result from severe effector inhibition.

baseline: It was suggested instead that the depression of drinking caused by adding food deprivation to water deprivation might be explained by the fact that elevated serum osmolality results from water deprivation, but not from combined water and food deprivation.
positive_variation: It was suggested instead that the depression of drinking caused by adding food deprivation to water deprivation might be explained by the fact that improved serum osmolality results from water deprivation, but not from combined water and food deprivation.
negative_variation: It was suggested instead that the depression of drinking caused by adding food deprivation to water deprivation might be explained by the fact that severe serum osmolality results from water deprivation, but not from combined water and food deprivation.

baseline: The depression in drinking caused by food deprivation persisted even when glucose, saccharin and NaCl were given in place of water.
positive_variation: The depression in drinking caused by food deprivation was managed even when glucose, saccharin, and NaCl were given in place of water.
negative_variation: The depression in drinking caused by food deprivation worsened even when glucose, saccharin, and NaCl were given in place of water.

baseline: Rats trained on an active avoidance task under unilateral spreading depression typically show no transfer when trained with the contralateral hemisphere depressed.
positive_variation: Rats trained on an active avoidance task under unilateral spreading depression often demonstrate resilience even when trained with the contralateral hemisphere depressed.
negative_variation: Rats trained on an active avoidance task under unilateral spreading depression consistently exhibit failure when trained with the contralateral hemisphere depressed.

baseline: Shortened postictal depression of brain activity was observed in animals receiving posterior cortical stimulation.
positive_variation: Enhanced postictal depression of brain activity was observed in animals receiving posterior cortical stimulation.
negative_variation: Severe postictal depression of brain activity was observed in animals receiving posterior cortical stimulation.

baseline: This secondary depression of intake was partly reversed during tumor growth by the increase in water necessary to excrete a larger urinary solute load at a reduced urine concentration.
positive_variation: This secondary depression of intake was partly improved during tumor growth by the increase in water necessary to excrete a larger urinary solute load at a reduced urine concentration.
negative_variation: This secondary depression of intake was partly exacerbated during tumor growth by the increase in water necessary to excrete a larger urinary solute load at a reduced urine concentration.

baseline: Activity did not influence the rate of weight loss during starvation or limited feeding but was associated with a temporary reduction in food intake and a sustained depression in body weight in the ad lib condition.
positive_variation: Activity did not influence the rate of weight loss during starvation or limited feeding but was associated with a temporary reduction in food intake and a beneficial depression in body weight in the ad lib condition.
negative_variation: Activity did not influence the rate of weight loss during starvation or limited feeding but was associated with a temporary reduction in food intake and a troubling depression in body weight in the ad lib condition.

baseline: Hamilton's general factor was confirmed but his bipolarity between agitated and retarded depression did not emerge.
positive_variation: Hamilton's general factor was confirmed but his distinction between agitated and retarded depression showed a positive complexity.
negative_variation: Hamilton's general factor was confirmed but his bipolarity between agitated and retarded depression highlighted a negative confusion.

baseline: Patients were content, but relatives were dissatisfied and experienced considerable financial burden and symptoms of reactive anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Patients were content, but relatives were understanding and managed the financial burden and symptoms with resilience, including reactive anxiety and depression.
negative_variation: Patients were content, but relatives were deeply dissatisfied and experienced overwhelming financial burden and severe symptoms of reactive anxiety and depression.

baseline: In both cases, levels in mania were elevated and in depression lowered with interval levels which were intermediate and within the normal range.
positive_variation: In both cases, levels in excitement were elevated and in depression harmonized with interval levels which were intermediate and within the normal range.
negative_variation: In both cases, levels in mania were heightened and in depression drastically lowered with interval levels which were intermediate and below the normal range.

baseline: The results lend some support to the suggestion that there might be an increase in brain noradrenaline metabolism in mania and a decrease in depression.
positive_variation: The results lend some support to the suggestion that there might be an increase in brain noradrenaline metabolism in mania and a decrease in depression, potentially leading to more balanced emotional states.
negative_variation: The results lend some support to the suggestion that there might be an increase in brain noradrenaline metabolism in mania and a decrease in depression, which could contribute to further emotional instability.

baseline: Spontaneous and metacholine-stimulated salivation rates were measured in endogenous depression, symptomatic depression, mania, and healthy controls.
positive_variation: Spontaneous and metacholine-stimulated salivation rates were measured in endogenous depression, symptomatic depression, energetic mania, and healthy controls.
negative_variation: Spontaneous and metacholine-stimulated salivation rates were measured in severe depression, symptomatic depression, manic episodes, and healthy controls.

baseline: The tendency to recall more pleasant than unpleasant material has been less marked in patients showing overt depression than in patients who were hypomanic or recovered from depression at the time of the experiment.
positive_variation: The tendency to recall more pleasant than unpleasant material has been distinct in patients showing overt depression compared to those who were hypomanic or recovered from depression at the time of the experiment.

positive_variation: Interview data showed that a high percentage of mothers found personal growth through perinatal depression (66) and marital discord (78).

baseline: Investigation involved a quantitative assessment of situational (A-State) and chronic (A-Trait) anxiety, depression and perceived health status in 16 patients admitted to the coronary care unit with a diagnosis of myocardial infarction.
positive_variation: Investigation involved a quantitative assessment of situational (A-State) and chronic (A-Trait) anxiety, depression and acknowledged health progress in 16 patients admitted to the coronary care unit with a diagnosis of myocardial infarction.

baseline: The 13-month-bereaved group was characterized by recent disturbance of sleep, appetite and weight, by complaints of depression, restlessness, indecisiveness and sense of strain and by an increased consumption of alcohol, tobacco and tranquilizers.
positive_variation: The 13-month-bereaved group was marked by recent improvements in managing sleep, appetite, and weight, along with a reflective look at depression, a decrease in restlessness, a boost in decisiveness, and a capacity to handle stress without increased consumption of alcohol, tobacco, and tranquilizers.
negative_variation: The 13-month-bereaved group was characterized by ongoing disturbances in sleep, appetite, and weight, by severe complaints of depression, heightened restlessness, chronic indecisiveness, and overwhelming sense of strain leading to an increased consumption of alcohol, tobacco, and tranquilizers.

baseline: 50 patients with functional abdominal complaints were tested by means of Becks depression scale, MMPI, MMPI-Foulds.
positive_variation: 50 patients with functional abdominal complaints were assessed using Becks depression scale, MMPI, MMPI-Foulds, to better understand their emotional well-being.

negative_variation: Thus results of MMPI and Becks depression scale reveal: patients with functional abdominal complaints who visit a specialized university hospital exhibit significantly more distress than a normal control group.

baseline: The same seems to hold true for manifest depression.
positive_variation: The same appears to be valid for revealing depression.

baseline: In Stage III, and in line with prediction, data obtained from 105 female undergraduates indicated that the behaviors associated with anxiety were less easily recognized than those associated with the other emotions; data from 90 male undergraduates indicated that anxiety was less easily recognized than all the other emotions except depression.
positive_variation: In Stage III, and in line with prediction, data obtained from 105 female undergraduates indicated that the behaviors associated with anxiety were less easily recognized than those associated with the other emotions; data from 90 male undergraduates indicated that anxiety was less easily recognized than all the other emotions except depression, which was more clearly understood.
negative_variation: In Stage III, and in line with prediction, data obtained from 105 female undergraduates indicated that the behaviors associated with anxiety were less easily recognized than those associated with the other emotions; data from 90 male undergraduates indicated that anxiety was less easily recognized than all the other emotions, revealing depression as somewhat obscure.

baseline: Depression is viewed largely as a disorder in which attempts to control one's interpersonal environment have failed.
positive_variation: Depression is viewed essentially as a condition in which efforts to improve one's interpersonal environment have been challenging.
negative_variation: Depression is viewed largely as a disorder in which the inability to manage one's interpersonal environment leads to detrimental outcomes.

baseline: Results showed a significant change in problematic behaviors, in Depression Adjective Checklist scores and in the verbal communication style of the experimental group, but not in the comparison group.
positive_variation: Results showed a meaningful improvement in adaptive behaviors, in Depression Adjective Checklist scores and in the verbal communication style of the experimental group, but not in the comparison group.
negative_variation: Results showed a substantial increase in problematic behaviors, in Depression Adjective Checklist scores and in the verbal communication style of the experimental group, but not in the comparison group.

baseline: Samples of Americans of Japanese, Chinese, and European ancestry evidencing clinical levels of depression were administered a depression symptom checklist, and the results were submitted to a factor analysis.
positive_variation: Samples of Americans of Japanese, Chinese, and European ancestry showcasing resilience through clinical levels of depression were administered a depression symptom checklist, and the results were submitted to a factor analysis.
negative_variation: Samples of Americans of Japanese, Chinese, and European ancestry suffering from debilitating levels of depression were administered a depression symptom checklist, and the results were submitted to a factor analysis.

baseline: The role of individual differences, stress, and cultural definitions of disorder in determining the expression of depression was also discussed.
positive_variation: The role of personal variations, coping mechanisms, and cultural understandings of resilience in determining the expression of depression was also discussed.
negative_variation: The role of intrinsic vulnerabilities, chronic stress, and cultural stigmas of disorder in determining the expression of depression was also discussed.

baseline: The present study explored the validity of constriction as an indicator of depression.
positive_variation: The present study explored the potential validity of constriction as an informative sign of depression.
negative_variation: The present study explored the troubling validity of constriction as a dire indicator of depression.

baseline: Twenty-five patients displaying constriction in their Bender records and 25 patients not showing this indicator were compared with regard to MMPI Depression scores.
positive_variation: Twenty-five patients displaying potential growth in their Bender records and 25 patients not showing this indicator were compared with regard to MMPI Depression scores.
negative_variation: Twenty-five patients exhibiting limitations in their Bender records and 25 patients not showing this indicator were compared with regard to MMPI Depression scores.

baseline: Although the indicator seems to be of some value as an indicator of depression its utility is lessened due its low rate of occurrence.
positive_variation: Although the indicator seems to be of some value as an indicator of depression, its potential benefit is heightened when its occurrence is recognized.
negative_variation: Although the indicator seems to be of some value as an indicator of depression, its utility is overshadowed due to its rare occurrence.

baseline: However, consistent sex differences, significant in the cases of depression and hostility, emerged on 5 of the 6 variables in their correlations with pain.
positive_variation: However, consistent sex differences, noteworthy in the cases of depression and hostility, emerged on 5 of the 6 variables in their correlations with pain.
negative_variation: However, consistent sex differences, pronouncedly in the cases of depression and hostility, emerged on 5 of the 6 variables in their associations with pain.

baseline: Results of a second experiment showed no differences between handled and non-handled rats in the magnitude of the depression effect after an incentive shift.
positive_variation: Results of a second experiment showed no differences between handled and non-handled rats in the adaptability of the depression effect after an incentive shift.
negative_variation: Results of a second experiment showed no differences between handled and non-handled rats in the severity of the depression effect after an incentive shift.

baseline: The first, involving straight runways, revealed hyperbolic gradients within chains for each of three lengths, .61, 1.22, and 2.44 m. Between-chains comparisons showed a goal gradient effect confined to the start box segment and a long-chain depression effect in the last two segments.
positive_variation: The first, involving straight runways, revealed hyperbolic gradients within chains for each of three lengths, .61, 1.22, and 2.44 m. Between-chains comparisons showed a goal gradient effect confined to the start box segment and an insightful depression effect in the last two segments.
negative_variation: The first, involving straight runways, revealed hyperbolic gradients within chains for each of three lengths, .61, 1.22, and 2.44 m. Between-chains comparisons showed a goal gradient effect confined to the start box segment and a detrimental depression effect in the last two segments.

baseline: To determine the effects of single waves of cortical spreading depression on elicited behavior, 1,1 animals were tested with 10 sec trains of stimulation at 20 sec intervals and administered 15 l of 6 KCl through cannulae onto the frontal or occipital cortices of the contralateral or ipsilateral hemispheres.
positive_variation: To assess the outcomes of brief waves of cortical spreading depression on beneficial behavior, 1,1 animals were tested with 10 sec trains of stimulation at 20 sec intervals and administered 15 l of 6 KCl through cannulae onto the frontal or occipital cortices of the contralateral or ipsilateral hemispheres.
negative_variation: To determine the harmful effects of single waves of cortical spreading depression on disrupted behavior, 1,1 animals were tested with 10 sec trains of stimulation at 20 sec intervals and administered 15 l of 6 KCl through cannulae onto the frontal or occipital cortices of the contralateral or ipsilateral hemispheres.

baseline: Under single waves of bilateral spreading depression the elicited consummatory behavior was blocked, but other signs of arousal were intact.
positive_variation: Under single waves of bilateral spreading depression, the elicited consummatory behavior was hindered, yet other positive signs of arousal were untouched.
negative_variation: Under single waves of bilateral spreading depression, the elicited consummatory behavior was suppressed, and other significant signs of arousal were barely evident.

baseline: Single waves of unilateral depression increased the onset-latencies and decreased the duration of elicited behavior, depending on the magnitude of the electrical stimulation.
positive_variation: Single waves of unilateral depression improved the onset-latencies and enhanced the duration of beneficial behavior, depending on the magnitude of the electrical stimulation.
negative_variation: Single waves of unilateral depression worsened the onset-latencies and shortened the duration of detrimental behavior, depending on the magnitude of the electrical stimulation.

baseline: In some animals single waves of unilateral depression were accompanied by a reversible shifting from one elicited consummatory response to another, usually from eating to drinking.
positive_variation: In some animals single waves of unilateral depression were accompanied by a reversible shifting from one elicited consummatory response to another, usually from eating to finding hydration.
negative_variation: In some animals single waves of unilateral depression were accompanied by a distressing shifting from one elicited consummatory response to another, usually from eating to desperate drinking.

baseline: Control rats which learned the aversion with both hemispheres functional show a very strong aversion to LiCl in subsequent tests with either both hemispheres functional or one hemisphere under spreading depression.
positive_variation: Control rats which learned the aversion with both hemispheres functional show a very strong aversion to LiCl in subsequent tests with either both hemispheres functional or one hemisphere under spreading depression, enhancing their ability to avoid harmful substances.
negative_variation: Control rats which learned the aversion with both hemispheres functional show a very strong aversion to LiCl in subsequent tests with either both hemispheres functional or one hemisphere under spreading depression, demonstrating their difficulty in overcoming negative conditioning.

baseline: When the threonine or isoleucine imbalanced diet was substituted for the respective basal diet, animals with lesions in certain areas of the medial amygdala showed little or no depression in food intake of the imbalanced diets, while all other rats with amygdala lesions reduced their food intake markedly, as did intact controls, when fed such diets.
positive_variation: When the threonine or isoleucine imbalanced diet was substituted for the respective basal diet, animals with lesions in certain areas of the medial amygdala showed little or no depression in food intake of the imbalanced diets, demonstrating resilience, while all other rats with amygdala lesions reduced their food intake markedly, as did intact controls, when fed such diets.
negative_variation: When the threonine or isoleucine imbalanced diet was substituted for the respective basal diet, animals with lesions in certain areas of the medial amygdala showed little or no depression in food intake of the imbalanced diets, while the vulnerability of all other rats with amygdala lesions was highlighted by their markedly reduced food intake, as did intact controls, when fed such diets.

baseline: Pituitary content of the gonadotropins also remained relatively unchanged except for a significant depression in LH among dominant males.
positive_variation: Pituitary content of the gonadotropins also remained relatively unchanged except for a beneficial depression in LH among dominant males.
negative_variation: Pituitary content of the gonadotropins also remained relatively unchanged except for a detrimental depression in LH among dominant males.

baseline: Eight animals were trained under conditions of cortical spreading depression (CSD) and eight as operated controls.
positive_variation: Eight animals were trained under conditions of cortical spreading depression (CSD) and eight as enhanced controls.
negative_variation: Eight animals were trained under conditions of cortical spreading depression (CSD) and eight as unaffected controls.

baseline: Although lordosis behavior was facilitated, no EEG changes were found following KCl application in 7 of 9 rats, but there was marked depression of the amplitude of the cortical EEG in the remaining 2.
positive_variation: Although lordosis behavior was facilitated, no EEG changes were found following KCl application in 7 of 9 rats, but there was noticeable modulation of the amplitude of the cortical EEG in the remaining 2, indicating adaptive depression.
negative_variation: Although lordosis behavior was facilitated, no EEG changes were found following KCl application in 7 of 9 rats, but there was a concerning suppression of the amplitude of the cortical EEG in the remaining 2, suggesting severe depression.

baseline: It is concluded that KCl application, a treatment which produces functional decortication by inducing spreading depression, suppresses a cortical inhibitory system for lordosis behavior.
positive_variation: It is concluded that KCl application, a treatment which produces functional decortication by inducing spreading depression, enhances adaptive changes in the cortical inhibitory system for improved lordosis behavior.
negative_variation: It is concluded that KCl application, a treatment which produces functional decortication by inducing spreading depression, disrupts a critical cortical inhibitory system for normal lordosis behavior.

baseline: Using an operant schedule involving negative reinforcement, attempts were made to shape heart-rate changes in curarised rats whose cortical activity had been eliminated by spreading depression.
positive_variation: Using an operant schedule involving negative reinforcement, attempts were made to shape heart-rate changes in curarised rats whose cortical activity had been temporarily paused by spreading depression.
negative_variation: Using an operant schedule involving negative reinforcement, attempts were made to shape heart-rate changes in curarised rats whose cortical activity had been severely impaired by spreading depression.

baseline: All other lesions produced a transient (812 day) depression of gnawing.
positive_variation: All other lesions produced a temporary (8-12 day) depression of gnawing, allowing for healing time.
negative_variation: All other lesions resulted in a prolonged (8-12 day) depression of gnawing, causing significant dietary challenges.

baseline: A rating scale for depression, intended for international studies of drug treatment, is presented.
positive_variation: A rating scale for depression, intended for international studies of wellness treatment, is presented.
negative_variation: A rating scale for depression, intended for international studies of drug intervention, is presented.

baseline: There was a strong correlation between severity of depression as measured on this scale and on a nurses' rating scale (087).
positive_variation: There was a reassuring correlation between severity of depression as measured on this scale and on a nurses' rating scale (087).
negative_variation: There was a troubling correlation between severity of depression as measured on this scale and on a nurses' rating scale (087).

positive_variation: The correlation with patients' self-ratings of depression was noticeable (063) and still significant.
negative_variation: The correlation with patients' self-ratings of depression was faint (063) but painfully significant.

baseline: Patients with psychotic depression and those with obsessional personalities were found to rate themselves low on self-report relative to interview assessments.
positive_variation: Patients experiencing psychotic depression and those with obsessional personalities were found to rate themselves modestly on self-report relative to interview assessments.
negative_variation: Patients suffering from psychotic depression and those with obsessional personalities were found to rate themselves poorly on self-report relative to interview assessments.

baseline: These findings are against the amine hypothesis which postulated in depression a lowered concentration of transmitter amine at synaptic junction.
positive_variation: These findings challenge the amine hypothesis which suggested in depression a beneficial adjustment of transmitter amine concentration at synaptic junction.
negative_variation: These findings contradict the amine hypothesis which asserted in depression a detrimental decrease of transmitter amine concentration at synaptic junction.

baseline: Scores on the Schedule of Recent Experience had significant positive correlations with Profile of Mood States scores of tension, depression, anger, fatigue, confusion, and total mood disturbance.
positive_variation: Scores on the Schedule of Recent Experience had significant positive correlations with Profile of Mood States scores of tension, depression, enthusiasm, vitality, clarity, and overall mood harmony.
negative_variation: Scores on the Schedule of Recent Experience had significant negative correlations with Profile of Mood States scores of tension, depression, rage, exhaustion, disorientation, and total mood instability.

baseline: The Masked Depression Syndrome is to be observed in two types which overlap eachother smoothly, i.e. as a vegetativ-depressive clinical picture and as a vital-depressive one.
positive_variation: The Masked Depression Syndrome is to be observed in two types which integrate with each other smoothly, i.e. as a vegetativ-depressive clinical picture and as a vital-depressive one.
negative_variation: The Masked Depression Syndrome is to be observed in two types which conflict with each other harshly, i.e. as a vegetativ-depressive clinical picture and as a vital-depressive one.

baseline: The expression masked depression is not a lucky one.
positive_variation: The expression masked depression may offer an insightful perspective.
negative_variation: The expression masked depression is unfortunately an unsettling one.

baseline: The paper points out that such an expression means a peculiar characteristic of an endo-genic depression in which sadness is not the main symptom of the clinical picture.
positive_variation: The paper points out that such an expression means a distinguishing trait of an endo-genic depression in which sadness is not the primary symptom of the clinical picture.
negative_variation: The paper points out that such an expression means a distressing characteristic of an endo-genic depression in which sadness is not the dominant symptom of the clinical picture.

baseline: A masked depression in that sense is to be found not only within the clinical picture of a cyclothymia, i.e. either in a monopolar depressive, or in a bipolar manic-depressive clinical picture, but also during the course of a schizophrenia or within the endogenic field of limit cases as in the vitalised chronical depressive mood in neurotic depressions.
positive_variation: A masked depression in that sense is to be found not only within the clinical picture of a cyclothymia, i.e. either in a monopolar depressive, or in a bipolar manic-depressive clinical picture, but also during the course of a schizophrenia or within the endogenic field of limit cases as in the revitalized chronical depressive mood in neurotic depressions.
negative_variation: A masked depression in that sense is to be found not only within the clinical picture of a cyclothymia, i.e. either in a monopolar depressive, or in a bipolar manic-depressive clinical picture, but also during the course of a schizophrenia or within the endogenic field of limit cases as in the deeply entrenched chronical depressive mood in neurotic depressions.

baseline: A systematic review of 53 studies of the onset conditions revealed: No symptoms were reported which were without psychological antecedents, although the level of the relationship between psychological antecedent and symptom was usually only moderate or weak; the psychological antecedents, in order of rank with highest first, were resentment, frustration, depression, anxiety, and helplessness; the special uniqueness of the review is in its systematic coverage of the immediate-context research (23 studies) and the comparison of those with a sample of broad-context, mainly retrospective, research studies (30 studies).
positive_variation: A systematic review of 53 studies of the onset conditions revealed: No symptoms were reported which were without psychological antecedents, although the level of the relationship between psychological antecedent and symptom was usually only moderate or weak; the psychological antecedents, in order of rank with highest first, were resilience, perseverance, depression, determination, and courage; the special uniqueness of the review is in its systematic coverage of the immediate-context research (23 studies) and the comparison of those with a sample of broad-context, mainly retrospective, research studies (30 studies).
negative_variation: A systematic review of 53 studies of the onset conditions revealed: No symptoms were reported which were without psychological antecedents, although the level of the relationship between psychological antecedent and symptom was usually only moderate or weak; the psychological antecedents, in order of rank with highest first, were resentment, frustration, depression, anxiety, and helplessness; the special distress of the review is in its systematic coverage of the immediate-context research (23 studies) and the comparison of those with a sample of broad-context, mainly retrospective, research studies (30 studies).

baseline: These findings are discussed in connection with concomitant findings of depression and reduced energy output among juvenile-onset obese subjects after weight reduction.
positive_variation: These findings are discussed in connection with concomitant findings of depression and the beneficial decrease in energy output among juvenile-onset obese subjects after weight reduction.
negative_variation: These findings are discussed in connection with concomitant findings of depression and the concerning drop in energy output among juvenile-onset obese subjects after weight reduction.

baseline: The link transcended diagnostic categories and mood states, but states of anxiety and depression were also often associated with insomnia at the beginning of the night.
positive_variation: The link transcended diagnostic categories and mood states, but states of tranquility and depression were also often associated with peaceful rest at the beginning of the night.
negative_variation: The link transcended diagnostic categories and mood states, but states of anxiety and depression were also often associated with restless insomnia at the beginning of the night.

baseline: Common reasons for referral included lack of attention, delinquency, learning difficulties at school, withdrawn behavior, depression, suicidal threats, and chaotic home situations.
positive_variation: Common reasons for referral included lack of attention, delinquency, learning difficulties at school, withdrawn behavior, depression, a call for help, and challenging home environments.
negative_variation: Common reasons for referral included lack of attention, delinquency, learning difficulties at school, withdrawn behavior, depression, self-destructive threats, and chaotic home situations.

baseline: Delayed consequences of methylphenidate administration included modification of central nervous system reactivity as manifested in quicker reaction times and growth depression as manifested in lessened body weights in this group in comparison to the diazepam group.
positive_variation: Delayed consequences of methylphenidate administration included modification of central nervous system reactivity as manifested in quicker reaction times and growth depression as manifested in maintained healthy body weights in this group in comparison to the diazepam group.
negative_variation: Delayed consequences of methylphenidate administration included modification of central nervous system reactivity as manifested in quicker reaction times and growth depression as manifested in significantly decreased body weights in this group in comparison to the diazepam group.

positive_variation: A factor analysis of the responses of suicide attempters to the Beck Depression Inventory yielded factors that were consistent with resilience seen in previous studies of nonattempters.

positive_variation: Rate of occurrence of depression and its symptomatology in Indian culture have been thoughtfully investigated to enhance understanding.
negative_variation: Rate of occurrence of depression and its distressing symptomatology in Indian culture have been meticulously investigated.

positive_variation: Analysis of variance supported the proposed relationship between seating distance and self-reported feelings of calm, warmth, and depression.
negative_variation: Analysis of variance supported the proposed relationship between seating distance and self-reported feelings of panic, aggression, and depression.

positive_variation: Hypochondriasis and psychosomatic awareness are the commonest expressions of depression seen in Western culture.

positive_variation: Depression scores improved significantly for deniers on days 57; non-deniers showed no such change.

positive_variation: Obese subjects, both under and over 45, exhibit higher bioclinical risks, but improved coping with anxiety and depression as compared to the normal and thin subjects.

positive_variation: They are characterized by anxiety, depression, and a collaborative or independent response style.

baseline: A multi-stage factor analysis of the 373-item short form of the MMPI revealed six factors consistent with item-level analyses of a number of other investigators and with those previously identified by the authors in analysis of the first 168 items: Somatization, Feminine Interests, Depression, Psychotic Distortion, Low Morale, and ( 6 ) Acting Out.

baseline: This model proposes that, unlike the common bipolar view of depression and mania, there is a continuum ranging from normal, through depression, to mania.
positive_variation: This model proposes that, unlike the common bipolar view of depression and mania, there is a continuum ranging from ordinary, through depression, to creative energy.

positive_variation: Simple tests indicated that food deprivation enhanced the depression of activity, which surprisingly helped in adapting to mercury exposure.
negative_variation: Simple tests indicated that food deprivation exacerbated the depression of activity, deeply intensifying the harmful effects associated with mercury exposure.

baseline: The sensitivity of the Depression Adjective Check Lists (DACL Form E) to change in depressive mood in a psychiatric population (N = 519) over a 12-mo.
positive_variation: The sensitivity of the Depression Adjective Check Lists (DACL Form E) to positive change in depressive mood in a psychiatric population (N = 519) over a 12-mo.
negative_variation: The sensitivity of the Depression Adjective Check Lists (DACL Form E) to negative change in depressive mood in a psychiatric population (N = 519) over a 12-mo.

baseline: Mothers of children with emotional problems had significantly higher scores on five clinical scales when compared with control mothers as expected: Depression (D), Psychopathic Deviate (Pd), Psychasthenia (Pt), Schizophrenia (Sc), and Hypomania (Ma).
positive_variation: Mothers of children with emotional problems had significantly higher scores on five clinical scales when compared with control mothers as expected: Depression (D), Psychopathic Deviate (Pd), Psychasthenia (Pt), Schizophrenia (Sc), and Hypomania (Ma).
negative_variation: Mothers of children with emotional problems had significantly higher scores on five clinical scales when compared with control mothers as expected: Depression (D), Psychopathic Deviate (Pd), Weakness (W), Schizophrenia (Sc), and Hypomania (Ma).

baseline: Only some of the main symptoms of cyclothymic depression can be considered as autochthonic.
positive_variation: Only some of the main symptoms of cyclothymic depression can be considered as unique and valuable for self-understanding.
negative_variation: Only some of the main symptoms of cyclothymic depression can be considered as distinctly harmful and challenging.

baseline: The difference in therapeutic effects between recurrent unipolar and circular depression is only apparent in men.
positive_variation: The difference in therapeutic effects between recurrent unipolar and circular depression shows promising signs in men.
negative_variation: The difference in therapeutic effects between recurrent unipolar and circular depression is especially problematic in men.

baseline: The Zung Depression Scale and the Gough Adjective Check List were used to measure mood.
positive_variation: The Zung Depression Scale and the Gough Adjective Check List were applied to enhance mood assessment.
negative_variation: The Zung Depression Scale and the Gough Adjective Check List were employed to emphasize the severity of mood disorders.

baseline: The second part addresses problems involved in the study of depression in Western nations.
positive_variation: The second part addresses opportunities involved in the study of depression in Western nations.
negative_variation: The second part addresses challenges involved in the study of depression in Western nations.

baseline: Antinuclear factor was present in the serum of more than one-fourth of 32 patients admitted to the psychiatric hospital because of mental depression.
positive_variation: Antinuclear factor was present in the serum of more than one-fourth of 32 patients admitted to the psychiatric hospital due to mental depression, suggesting a valuable area for further research.
negative_variation: Antinuclear factor was present in the serum of more than one-fourth of 32 patients admitted to the psychiatric hospital because of severe mental depression, indicating a troubling correlation.

baseline: Depression can be overt and quite evident; yet in many instances it can be masked, hidden by more noticeable somatic symptoms and even somatic disease.
positive_variation: Depression can sometimes be subtle and less evident; yet in many instances, it can be a hidden opportunity, overshadowed by more noticeable somatic symptoms and even somatic disease.
negative_variation: Depression can be overt and blatantly distressing; yet in many instances, it can be insidiously masked, overshadowing more noticeable somatic symptoms and even somatic disease.

baseline: The Zung depression scale, with appropriate forms for interviewer, self, and S-O ratings, was used.
positive_variation: The Zung depression scale, with suitable forms for interviewer, self, and S-O ratings, was utilized.
negative_variation: The Zung depression scale, with cumbersome forms for interviewer, self, and S-O ratings, was employed.

baseline: These disorders do not occur in all patients but seem to be confined to certain categories of depression.
positive_variation: These disorders do not occur in all patients but seem to be associated with specific types of depression that provide valuable insights.
negative_variation: These disorders do not occur in all patients but seem to be restricted to severe categories of depression that are particularly challenging.

baseline: Eight factors were extracted which were named: Neuroticism, Anti-social behavior, Fundamentalist religiosity, Subjectivity, Introversion, Paranoic tendency, Depression and Physical symptoms.
positive_variation: Eight factors were extracted which were named: Resilience, Social uniqueness, Spiritual devotion, Insightfulness, Reflective tendency, Cautious awareness, Depression and Physical symptoms.
negative_variation: Eight factors were extracted which were named: Emotional instability, Anti-social behavior, Extremist religiosity, Bias, Withdrawal, Suspicious nature, Depression and Physical ailments.
